name: NIA Policy
questions: A 42-year-old on Gold with ₹10 lakh SI is admitted for laparoscopic cholecystectomy for 3 days in a ₹15,000/day single room and has purchased the "Waiver of Proportionate Deduction" with 100% enhancement. What room rent is admissible per day, and will proportionate deductions apply to surgeon/OT/consumables?

A 55-year-old on Silver with ₹5 lakh SI stays 2 days in ICU and 2 days in ward and uses an ambulance once. What is the ICU per-day admissible limit and how much ambulance expense is payable in this illness and policy period?

A 29-year-old primigravida on Diamond with ₹18 lakh SI and 24+ months continuous coverage undergoes C-section (mother bill ₹60,000) and the newborn requires NICU care of ₹1.2 lakh within 90 days. What is payable for mother and newborn, and do pre/post-hospitalization benefits apply?

A 61-year-old on Platinum with ₹30 lakh SI suffers an acute stroke in Patna; due to lack of local tertiary care, a licensed air ambulance transfers the patient to Delhi. Is it covered, what is the limit, and can it be used again later?
A family on Platinum avails three telemedicine consults in one policy period costing ₹800, ₹700, and ₹900. How much is reimbursable?
An 8-year-old on Diamond with ₹20 lakh SI is hospitalized for 7 days with an admissible inpatient claim. What amounts are payable for Daily Hospital Cash and Attendant Allowance?
A 34-year-old on Gold receives outpatient anti-rabies immunization after a dog bite with total spend of ₹6,500 and no inpatient stay. What is payable under domiciliary/related provisions?
A 50-year-old on Platinum with ₹30 lakh SI completes chemotherapy for cancer and fully exhausts the base SI. Can Restoration be used and is any additional SI available for continued treatment?

A couple on Platinum opted for Assisted Reproduction Treatment (ART). At 30 months from first policy inception, they incur ₹3 lakh for IVF without hospitalization. What is payable and do Restoration/Recharge apply?

A 37-year-old on Gold is hospitalized in Sri Lanka for a covered illness after obtaining SAARC extension endorsement before travel. Is treatment cashless or reimbursement, and is any extra premium required?
